before.enText: often in names of particular awards

data.enText: a prize such as money, etc. for sth that sb has done

data.chText: 因某事赢得 / 得到 / 获得奖项
data.enText: to win/receive/get an award for sth

data.chText: 他获得最佳演员奖提名。
data.enText: He was nominated for the best actor award.
an increase in the amount of money sb earns
the amount of money that a court decides should be given to sb who has won a case; the decision to give this money

data.chText: 裁定名誉损害赔偿60万英镑

data.enText: the official decision to give sth (such as a diploma ) to sb

data.chText: 合格完成此课程者将获得社会福利工作文凭。
data.enText: Satisfactory completion of the course will lead to the award of the Diploma of Social Work.
money that students get to help pay for living costs while they study or do research
to make an official decision to give sth to sb as a payment, prize, etc.

data.chText: 他判得损害赔偿金5万英镑。
裁判判定决赛双方得分相等。

data.hoverText: 动词+名词短语+名词短语

data.enText: The judges awarded equal points to both finalists.

data.chText: 裁判判定决赛双方得分相等。
data.enText: The judges awarded both finalists equal points.

ex.chText: 牛津大学授予他博士头衔。
ex.enText: Oxford University conferred the title of doctor on him.
The President conferred a metal on her.

synonyms.bx: 尤指作为对所取得成绩的奖励而授予某人学位、荣誉、权利、名号等，常与介词 on/upon 连用。

ex.enText: He was accorded permission to meet the king.
She was accorded a cold welcome.

ex.chText: 我们的社会赋予家庭十分重要的地位。
ex.enText: Our society accords great importance to the family.

synonyms.bx: 指授予某人或某事物权力、地位、某种待遇等。

ex.enText: She was awarded for being the best student.

ex.chText: 她获得了去哈佛大学读书的奖学金。
ex.enText: She has been awarded a scholarship to study at Harvard.
The panel of judges awarded him first prize.

synonyms.bx: 指官方或经正式研究决定后对成绩突出者或竞赛优胜者给予奖励、奖金等。

ex.enText: The trophy is bestowed on the winner.

ex.chText: 该国给这位民族英雄颁发了国家最高奖章。
ex.enText: The country bestowed its highest medal upon the national hero.

synonyms.bx: 指授予某人具有重大价值或意义的东西，尤用于表示尊重，常和介词 on/upon 连用。

tr: a grant made by a law court
example: he criticized the awarding of compensation by the court

tr: a tangible symbol signifying approval or distinction
something given for victory or superiority in a contest or competition or for winning a lottery
example: the prize was a free trip to Europe

tr: give, especially as an honor or reward
example: bestow honors and prizes at graduation

tr: give as judged due or on the basis of merit
Funds are granted to qualified researchers"
example: the referee awarded a free kick to the team
the jury awarded a million dollars to the plaintiff

value.def: An award is a prize or certificate that a person is given for doing something well.

example.ex: ...the Booker prize, Britain's top award for fiction...
example.tran: 布克奖，英国小说界的最高荣誉

example.ex: She presented a bravery award to schoolgirl Caroline Tucker.
example.tran: 她向女学生卡罗琳·塔克颁发了英勇奖状。

value.def: In law, an award is a sum of money that a court decides should be given to someone.
A pay award is an increase in pay for a particular group of workers.

example.ex: ...this year's average pay award for teachers of just under 8%.
example.tran: 今年教师平均加薪幅度将近8%

value.def: If someone is awarded something such as a prize or an examination mark, it is given to them.

example.ex: She was awarded the prize for both films...
example.tran: 她的两部电影双双获奖。

example.ex: For his dedication the Mayor awarded him a medal of merit.
example.tran: 为表彰他的奉献精神，市长授予他荣誉奖章。

value.def: To award something to someone means to decide that it will be given to that person.

example.ex: We have awarded the contract to a British shipyard...
example.tran: 我们将合同给了一家英国造船厂。

example.ex: A High Court judge had awarded him £6 million damages.
example.tran: 高级法院法官裁定他获得600万英镑的损失赔偿金。

trans: 学院奖；奥斯卡金像奖；奥斯卡；奥斯卡奖；金像奖
颁奖仪式；颁奖晚会；颁奖典礼；颁奖盛典；颁奖大会

特別獎；特别奖；获奖特别奖；金马影展；荣获特殊奖
授标；合同授予；发包；签订合同；合同签约
美国国家图书奖；国家图书奖
终局仲裁裁决，终局性仲裁裁决
埃德加奖；爱伦坡奖；埃德加·爱伦·坡奖；爱伦·坡奖；艾德格奖
麦克罗伯特奖；罗伯特奖
